titles.title: Voting Equipment Compatibility With Instant Runoff Voting Act of 2001
To direct the Federal Election Commission to make grants to States which have adopted an instant runoff voting system for presidential elections, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary: 11/6/2001--Introduced. Voting Equipment Compatibility With Instant Runoff Voting Act of 2001 - Establishes a program under which the Federal Election Commission shall make grants to eligible States to defray the costs of administering an instant runoff voting system adopted for presidential elections, including the costs of purchasing voting equipment, software, and other technology necessary for such a system.Requires each State to administer elections for Federal office using voting equipment and technology compatible with an instant runoff voting system.
